name: Airlock Digital
description: This app provides investigative, containment and management actions for Airlock Digital's Execution Control & Allowlisting endpoint product.
publisher: Domenico Perre & Airlock Digital Pty Ltd
license: Copyright (c) Domenico Perre & Airlock Digital Pty Ltd, 2020

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
actions.verbose: This endpoint will test connectivity with an Airlock Digital server.

actions.description: Unblock (remove) hashes from one or more Blocklist policies
actions.verbose: This action will unblock hashes from one or more Blocklist policies. This is useful if you want to 'un-ban' a particular hash value.

blocklistid.description: Remove hash(es) from a specific blocklist by specifying the id, or leave this black to remove it from all blocklists

actions.description: Disallow (remove) hashes from one or more Application Captures
actions.verbose: This action will allow you to remove hashes for an existing Application Capture that exists on the Airlock Server.

applicationid.description: Remove hash(es) from a specific Application Capture by specifying the id, or leave this black to remove it from all Application Captures

actions.description: Gathers a list of identifiers which are required for referencing groups, applications, baselines or blocklists in other actions
actions.verbose: This action gathers the identifiers which reference the groups, applications, baselines or blocklists within Airlock. These identifiers are required to call other actions within Phantom in order to interact with the Airlock Server.

policy_type.description: The type can be group, application, baseline or blocklist

actions.description: List the policy configuration of a specified group
actions.verbose: This action will return the policy configurations that are applied to the specified group, the group in this action is referenced by the groupid.

group_id.description: The group id of the group you want to retrieve policy configuration from

actions.description: Moves an endpoint from one group to another
actions.verbose: This action moves an enforcement agent registration from one group within Airlock to another. This requires the destination groupID to be referenced in the request as the 'target'. The source group does not need to be specified.

group_id.description: Destination group id, can be obtained from the list identifiers endpoint

agent_id.description: Agent id, can be obtained from the list endpoints action

actions.description: Allow (add) hashes in a Application Capture policy
actions.verbose: This endpoint allows for the submission of a SHA256 hash value into an existing Application Capture policy.

hash.description: Hash of file(s) to allow in an Application Capture

applicationid.description: Allow hash(es) in a specific Application Capture by specifying the id

path.description: Specify a file path which represents the hash of the file you are adding. If you don't want to do this, use the default however this parameter is required for population of file repository entries in Airlock. Note that the path must be escaped.

example_values: Some hashes failed to be added because it is in an invalid format

actions.description: Block (add) hashes in a Blocklist policy
actions.verbose: This action allows you to add hashes to a Blocklist policy. By adding a hash into a Blocklist policy that is approved, it has the result of blocking the hash on endpoints within your environment.
This endpoint will simply return a listing of registered agents from the Airlock Server. This list can be filtered based on certain criteria.
Revoke an active OTP code by specifying the 'otpcode' you want to revoke.

otpid.description: The ID of the OTP Code you want to revoke

actions.verbose: Retrieve an OTP code for a particular computer (agent) within Airlock. You must specify the OTP 'duration' and unique 'agentid' to retrieve the code. Unique 'agentid' parameters can be obtained from the /agent/find endpoint.

agentid.description: Agentid can be found using /agent/find, this will be the unique ID of a computer.

purpose.description: Message about why you are requesting the OTP Code

actions.verbose: Query the Airlock file repository by specifying the hash value(s) you would like to lookup. NOTE: Only SHA256 hashes are supported.
